channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Democrats Have Finally Learned the Value of Shitposting
item.description: After struggling through a changing social media landscape for years, Democratic strategists have figured out how to go viral.

item.title: The EU’s AI Act is now in force
item.description:
The European Union's risk-based regulation for applications of artificial intelligence has come into force starting from today.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: A $500 Open-Source Tool Lets Anyone Hack Computer Chips With Lasers
item.description: The RayV Lite will make it hundreds of times cheaper for anyone to carry out physics-bending feats of hardware hacking.

item.title: Healx, an AI-enabled drug discovery platform for rare diseases, raises $47M
item.description:
The company also said it has received regulatory clearance to start Phase 2 clinical trials for a new drug in the U.S. later this year.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: How Telegram Game 'Hamster Kombat' Got 300 Million Users—and the Ire of Iran’s Military
item.description: In June, Iranian authorities claimed the crypto game was distracting voters during the presidential election. Last month, Telegram's CEO touted its potential to bring millions to blockchain. Its creators say they’re just getting started.

item.title: EU greenlights HPE’s $14B Juniper Networks acquisition
item.description:
The European Commission (EC) has given the go-ahead to HPE's planned megabucks acquisition of Juniper Networks.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: 8 Best Cheap Smartphones (2024): iPhone, Android, 5G
item.description: There’s little reason to pay top dollar for a smartphone. These iPhones and Android devices—ranging from $150 to $500—stood up to WIRED’s testing.

item.title: Zuckerberg says Meta will need 10x more computing power to train Llama 4 than Llama 3
item.description:
Meta, which develops one of the biggest foundational open-source large language models, Llama, believes it will need significantly more computing power to train models in the future. Mark Zuckerberg said on Meta’s second-quarter earnings call on Tuesday that to train Llama 4 the company will need 10x more compute than what was needed to train […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The Cure for Disposable Plastic Crap Is Here—and It’s Loony
item.description: Stretchy seaweed, reverse vending machines, QR-coded take-out boxes: They’re how we can break society’s absurd addiction to single-use plastics.

item.title: Axle Energy’s sprint to decarbonize the grid lights up with $9M seed led by Accel
item.description:
Axle Energy is a B2B, back-end infrastructure business focused on connecting flexible assets, such as electric vehicles and home batteries, to energy markets that aren't otherwise available for consumers to dip into.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.
